explanations.A: Here we have 4 (-1) counters and 2 (-1) counters, showing -4 + -2 = -6
explanations.B: Check the counters you have used. We are trying to add together -4 and -2, so what colour counters will we use for each?
explanations.C: We will start at -4 on the number line for this calculation, but if we are adding -2 we do not move up the number line by 2
explanations.D: These don't all work. Check the signs used carefully. Do we have negatives where we should have negatives?

explanations.B: This does show -3 + -1, but is there another diagram that also works?
explanations.C: This does show -3 + -1, but is there another diagram that also works?

explanations.A: I think you've done -5 + -3, but this is a missing number addition problem. What do we need to add to -5 to get an answer of -3?
explanations.B: I think you've tried to do -5 + -3, but this is a missing number addition problem. What do we need to add to -5 to get an answer of -3?
explanations.C: Nearly! If we start with 5 (-1) counters and we add 2 more (-1) counters, what counters will we have at the end?
explanations.D: In our answer we have 2 fewer (-1) counters. In order to make this happen we need to add 2 (+1) counters to make zero pairs which will cancel out those extra 2 negatives. So we have added +2

explanations.A: Nearly! If we start with 4 (-1) counters and we add 3 more (-1) counters, what counters will we have at the end?
explanations.B: In our answer we have 3 fewer (-1) counters. In order to make this happen we need to add 3 (+1) counters to make zero pairs which will cancel out those extra 3 negatives. So we have added +3
explanations.C: I think you've done -4 + -1, but this is a missing number addition problem. What do we need to add to -4 to get an answer of -1?
explanations.D: I think you've tried to do -4 + -1, but this is a missing number addition problem. What do we need to add to -4 to get an answer of -1?

explanations.A: Here we have 2 (-1) counters and we have added 3 (-1) counters. Does that match the calculation in the question?
explanations.B: We start with the 2 (-1) counters on the left. We then add 3 lots of zero pairs which don't change the value of what we have. We can now see that subtracting 5 of the (-1) counters will leave us with 3 (+1) counters. So -2 - -5 = 3
explanations.C: Here we have 2 (-1) counters and we have added 3 (+1) counters. Does that match the calculation in the question?
explanations.D: Nearly! Here we have started with the 2 (-1) counters and have added zero pairs to help with our calculation, but what number is left at the end? Does that match our calculation?

explanations.A: Here we have 3 (-1) counters and we have added 1 more (-1) counter. Does that match the calculation in the question?
explanations.B: Nearly! Here we have started with the 3 (-1) counters and have added a zero pair to help with our calculation, but what number is left at the end? Does that match our calculation?
explanations.C: Here we have 3 (-1) counters and we have added 1 (+1) counter. Does that match the calculation in the question?
explanations.D: We start with the 3 (-1) counters on the left. We then add a zero pair which doesn't change the value of what we have. We can now see that subtracting 4 of the (-1) counters will leave us with 1 (+1) counter. So -3 - -4 = 1
